message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: I would like to obtain information on the per capita health expenditure and life expectancy among residents of the five Nordic countries during the period 2020–2023 (including 2020 and 2023).

 Please present the compiled data in one Markdown table. The column headers, in order, should be: Country, Year, Per Capita Health Expenditure (EUR), Life Expectancy (Years), Domestic government health expenditure (% of GDP), Out-of-pocket expenditure (% of current health expenditure). If any data point cannot be found, please indicate it as NA.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To compile this data, we need to gather health expenditure per capita, life expectancy, domestic government health expenditure as a percentage of GDP, and out-of-pocket expenditure as a percentage of current health expenditure for each country over the specified years.

Let's start with finding the per capita health expenditure and life expectancy for the Nordic countries.
</think>

<search> Nordic countries per capita health expenditure 2020-2023 </search>

Search query: Nordic countries per capita health expenditure 2020-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.XPD.CHEX.PC.CD?locations=SE):
Current health expenditure per capita (current US$) - Sweden Current health expenditure per capita (current US$) - Sweden. Global Health Expenditure database, World Health Organization ( WHO ), uri: apps.who.int/nha/ ...

[Doc 2](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/swe/sweden/healthcare-spending):
Sweden Healthcare Spending | Historical Chart & Data - Macrotrends Sweden healthcare spending per capita for 2023 was $6,152, a 3.52% increase from 2022. Sweden healthcare spending per capita for 2022 was $5,943, ...

[Doc 3](https://www.oecd.org/content/dam/oecd/en/publications/reports/2025/12/country-health-profile-2025-country-notes_7e72146d/sweden_89cbfa25/a77d5bfa-en.pdf):
[PDF] State of Health in the EU - SwEdEn - OECD Sweden's healthcare spending ranks fourth highest in the EU at EUR 4 688 per capita in 2023, approximately one fifth above the EU average.

From these documents, we get general trends but not the exact per capita health expenditure in Euros for each year, which we'll need to infer or assume from available data points.

<search> Nordic countries life expectancy 2020-2023 </search>

Search query: Nordic countries life expectancy 2020-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.nordicstatistics.org/news/nordic-life-expectancy-hits-832-years-exceeding-pre-pandemic-level/):
Nordic life expectancy hits 83.2 years, exceeding pre-pandemic level In 2024, life expectancy in the Nordics ranged from 82.3 to 84.1 years, with the exception of Greenland which stood out with 71.3 years [2].

[Doc 2](https://data.who.int/countries/578):
Norway - WHO Data In Norway, healthy life expectancy at birth (years) has improved by ▲ 3.33 years from 67.8 [67.1 - 68.7] years in 2000 to 71.2 [70.5 - 72.1] years in 2021.

[Doc 3](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/nor/norway/life-expectancy):
Norway Life Expectancy (1950-2025) - Macrotrends Norway life expectancy for 2023 was 83.11, a 0.73% increase from 2022. Norway life expectancy for 2022 was 82.51, a 0.79% decline from 2021. Life expectancy at ...

We see some life expectancy data but still lack detailed breakdowns across all years and countries in Euros. We need more granular and consistent data to fill out our table properly.

<search> Nordic countries government health expenditure % GDP 2020-2023 </search>

Search query: Nordic countries government health expenditure % GDP 2020-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.XPD.GHED.GD.ZS?locations=NO):
Domestic general government health expenditure (% of GDP) Domestic general government health expenditure (% of GDP) - Norway from The World Bank: Data.

[Doc 2](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Healthcare_expenditure_statistics_-_overview):
Healthcare expenditure statistics - overview - European Commission Current healthcare expenditure in the EU was €1 720 billion in 2023. This was equivalent to 10.0% of gross domestic product (GDP). Among EU countries ...

[Doc 3](https://eurohealthobservatory.who.int/publications/i/sweden-health-system-summary):
Sweden: health system summary 2023 Public expenditure on health was 86% of total health expenditure in 2020, well above the EU average for that year (75%).

From these documents, we can piece together some percentages, but it's still insufficient to fill all cells.

Search query: Nordic countries out-of-pocket expenditure % of current health expenditure 2020-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.XPD.OOPC.CH.ZS):

[Doc 2](https://www.healthsystemtracker.org/indicator/access-affordability/out-of-pocket-spending/):
Out-of-pocket spending - Peterson-KFF Health System Tracker Average out-of-pocket health spending per capita, US dollars, 2022 or nearest year (current prices and PPP adjusted) ; Switzerland. $1,688 ; United States. $1,425.

[Doc 3](https://www.oecd.org/content/dam/oecd/en/publications/reports/2025/12/country-health-profile-2025-country-notes_7e72146d/sweden_89cbfa25/a77d5bfa-en.pdf):
